reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Montecarlo is a pleasant enough hotel, but I can't quite subscribe to the enthusiasm of some of its fans here on Tripadvisor. I was there for three nights in May '10 for a brief break for myself and my wife.
reviews.title: Pleasant enough, just not much atmosphere

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had an executive room, which included a massive bathroom with jacuzzi, a small sitting room and a bedroom with a quirky electric bed (bit silly, I thought, but the room has been modified for disabled use, and I suspect this is part of that). The decor is stuck between refurbishments, so plenty of 80's beech combines with restored plasterwork and antique furniture. Small balcony looking out over La Ramblas (the weather was too bad to use this much, and the Montecarlo can hardly be held responsible for that). Effective blackout curtains and double glazing means the noise and light impact is minimised.
reviews.title: Can't go wrong with the Hotel Montecarlo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is undeniably excellent, even if La Rambla palls after a day or two, but undermined by its position directly above the Metro line. This means wondering if you are being chased by a herd of bulls as you are roused from unconsciousness in the early hours (I was sure I was in Pamploma!). Must be worse further down, and I was on the third floor...
reviews.title: meets your expectations if you've read these reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff are genuinely friendly and helpful, recommended restaurants and potential places we might like to visit. The breakfasts were very good, but the general ambience of the hotel is fairly dead, with few public spaces and not much atmosphere. Some of the hotels across the street looked more exciting, with their own restaurants, thriving bars and better decor. As Barcelona is full of these things, perhaps this is not so relevant, but I might cross La Rambla on my next visit.
reviews.title: outstanding staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This charming hotel is housed in an elegant old villa located on Barcelona's famous Rambla. It's easy walking distance to a subway stop as well as to the Barri Gotic and Plaza Catalunya. There are wonderful discoveries in every direction. The hotel boasts clean, modern rooms and a wonderful staff. All in all, it deserves its high ranking here on Trip Advisor, which is how I found it.
reviews.title: Best in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Montecarlo was fabulous! This was our first trip to Barcelona and we wanted a location that was central to the touristic sites. When we first walked down La Rambla to the hotel, we were apprehensive because La Rambla was SO packed with people and full of activity - we were worried that it would go on all night and that our room would be noisy. We asked for a quiet room and got 206, which turned out to be in the new part of the hotel on a private courtyard (private to other buildings). Even though we kept the window the the courtyard open every night, we slept in complete silence and tranquility. That was the first thing we loved about the hotel: being in the middle of everything and having it be quiet at night.
reviews.title: Lovely, quiet hotel in the middle of everything

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Besides that: the hotel is stunning. It is a beautiful old (Beaux Arts?) building that has been updated with modern design giving it the best of both worlds. We did not see rooms in the old part, but ours, in the new part was simple and lovely. It had a platform bed, a built-in desk with a free internet line, an ample closet, a chair and small table, and a spacious bathroom. In fact, the bathroom was really gorgeous, with chocolate brown slate tiles, a jacuzzi tub, and modern fixtures. The pictures on the website do not do this hotel justice. It is much prettier!
reviews.title: Great hotel and great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the mezzanine is a beautiful old sitting room with a magnificent fireplace and lots of sitting areas. It has chairs where you can sit and watch all of the activity on the street.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The people working at the hotel were extremely helpful and courteous. The hotel is just two blocks from the Plaza Catalunya, which is where the fabulous touristic buses board and where the airport bus stops. Thus, you can get to the hotel from the airport for only 4 Euros (30 minute trip).
reviews.title: Wiorst Experience Ever

We had a sitting room as well as a balcony overlooking Las Rambla. Because of the double doors on the balcony, the room was quiet.

reviews.title: A delightful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We selected this hotel because of the location and great reviews on TripAdvisor. We never expected to have much interaction with the staff but were impressed from the first moment we arrived by the friendliness and desire to make us feel welcome to the hotel and Barcelona. Our first night in Barcelona I had an accident and required a hospital visit. I cannot express how much the staff helped us to work through the issues involved and make sure we were taken care of. On top of that - the room was fabulous, the location can't be beat and the breakfast was wonderful. Thank you to the staff for taking such good care of us. If you're going to Barcelona - the Hotel Montecarlo is the best the city has to offer!
reviews.title: Genuine and Caring Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As many of the reviews say, we booked Montecarlo hotel based on the reviews. We stayed two nights on a weekend and it was perfect. The location is perfect. The staff is great and the rooms are what you paid for. I know it´s not the Waldorf Astoria but why would it be ? We did not eat at the hotel so it was not a problem for us.
reviews.title: Agreed can not go wrong with Montecarlo Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I say it again, you can not go wrong with Montecarlo.
reviews.title: Excellent room!!!

reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel. It is a pleasure to stay here.

reviews.text: ThIs is the second time we have stayed at this wonderful Hotel and we would not consider staying anywhere else.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We chose this hotel based on the TripAdvisor rating and were very pleased. The interesting 19th Century building is beautifully redecorated to a high standard. We chose a superior room and were given a nice suite. Excellent maintenance.
reviews.title: Great Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were very pleasant and helpful. The location is excellent for walking about the city. No nickle and diming - wifi free, mini bar inexpensive. A great spot.
reviews.title: Fantastic all round!

likes.liked: — The location, the jacuzzi and the rooftop views!

reviews.title: Good location, clean and comfortable. You wont be disappointed
reviews.text: Fantastic location - 5 minute walk from the Aerobus (From the airport) stop in Plaza Catalunya. Great staff - Perfect English, plus helpful, friendly and always polite. Right in the middle of everything - On La Rambla, a walk to the beach, a short walk to the Gothic Quarter, a good walk to Sagrada Familia. Great room - Clean, massively comfortable beds, lovely welcome pack, plus a Jacuzzi in the bathroom!!! It was a fantastic place! The breakfast was a little pricey at 9 Euros each, but very, very good....buffet, with a selection of cold and cooked meats, fruit a range of breads and lovely, freshly squeezed orange juice.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all, it was close to everything - whether that be restaurants, famous sites, bus stops, the beach, culture - way more than a 3 star and for the centre of such a great city as Barcelona, fairly priced.....everything was great! I cannot recommend it enough! One thing to remember is that when you book on your respective websites (I went with Opodo), it didn't detail the 7% Service/VAT Charge......took me by surprise, but it was no fault of the hotel, just something I forgot to take in to account! But, if you go, you will not be disappointed!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked a 4 night stay here in August on the back of the tripadvisor reviews and wasn't dissapointed. The hotel is in a great location on Las Ramblas, 5min from Placa Catalunya where the "aerobus" from the airport stops (last stop). The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room we had on the 2nd floor was great. Very recently renovated with wooden floor, tasteful furnishings and a really nice bathroom with Jacuzzi bath and shower. The matress on the bed was also adjustable via a small control although if I had one complaint it would be the mattress is a bit soft. We had the breakfast once at Eur9 each it wasn't really worth it. you are better off having breakfast on the go by getting something from a local bakery or sitting down at a cafe. As far as hotel breakfasts go though most people will probably be happy.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel and location, would stay again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: excellent location ,room we stayed in 304 very nice could nt fault it.Dont bother with breakfast option,12 euros as there are loads of cafes nearby,in fact one next door.Moka.The staff on front desk are very nice and friendly,nothing is too much trouble.Other advice I would give would be to use the Aerobus not a taxi between the aiport and city centre.Cost 4.25 euros on bus or 32 euros in taxi.The bus es stop and depart from Plaza Catalunya,outside El Corte Inglais dept store,which is a 5 min walk from hotel.There is a massive selection of places to eat in this city,my favs were the Basque Tapas bars.Here its self service,the Tapas are works of art ,things like stuffed peppers,salmon ontop of small breads,tuna etc.Each cost about 1.6 euros.Try Bilbao Berri,Bar Irrarti,or Taktika Berri...save the sticks,they count them up and charge you accordingly.I would go out of my way to find the three bars I have mentioned.However for visitors from uk,due to exchange rate Barcelona is an expensive city to visit.I thought it would be cheaper to eat at Tapas bars on Boquira Market...they cook them to order average price £10 for a plate of mushrooms.
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just came back from a weekend in Barcelona after my girlfriend's birthday. Thought I'd push the boat out a bit and stay in what for me was a fairly expensive hotel.
reviews.title: Really good quality hotel

likes.disliked: — No tea or coffee making facillities

reviews.text: Like all say, it's in a great location and the staff were incredibly friendly & helpful & spoke impeccable English. The room was very clean and spacious & the beds were very comfortable & just great because I usually thrash about a bit in my sleep & as the bed is in two halves (joined) I didn't disturb my girlfriend & we both woke up refreshed - unusual for a hotel stay.

reviews.text: On the whole it wasn't too noisy but there was a little intrusion from car horns (front bedroom) & the nearby clock chimes hourly through the night.
reviews.title: This Really Is The Best Hotel in Barcelona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The jacuzzi bath was a real treat and runs for 10 mins then has to have a 20 min rest & the massage shower was fun.
reviews.title: Just loved it !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Montecarlo hotel, from the outside, looks very traditional with a large marble lobby and impressive windows and so we were expecting a bit of a traditional style inside. How wrong we were! the lobby area inside is quite small and very contempory - all dark wood and polished glass. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful and directed us to our second floor room at the back of the hotel. The rooms were absolutely fantastic. The bed was made up as a double but was actually two singles set together. this was not a problem as they were moveable - you pressed a button and the head or feet of the bed went up or down to get into the best possible position for you. the floor was laminated wood and very clean and the best bit was the blinds on the windows. It was a full shutter that was elecronically operated and stopped all daylight getting in - fantastic first thing in the morning! Would definately recommend a room at the back of the hotel as the front rooms can get a but noisy at night. the bathroom had a large corner jacuzzi bath, bidet, wc and his and her's sinks. All very clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Right on the Ramblas, brilliant rooms!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008
reviews.text: There is a small bar to the rear of the hotel with a small space outside in a sort of walled courtyard. They have tried to get a bit of atmosphere here by putting in a large pond and running water, which was pretty nice and hid the noise of the city. All in all a very nice hotel, well situated half way up the main street. Would recommend.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: After checking on hotels at Tripadvisor, we picked the Hotel Monte Carlo, staying 3 days from 2-5 October. We booked a deluxe room (#402) for 270 Euros through Venere.com at the last minute. We were shocked and amazed by our room! The bathroom alone was bigger than most of our hotel rooms in Europe, all redone in marble with jacuzzi, separate shower, exercise bike and lots of windows providing mellow light. We had a living room with WiFi and cable TV, and the bedroom was palatial, with an adjustable bed that raised both head and/or feet, with a balcony overlooking Las Ramblas, the best location in Barcelona! The entire staff was super friendly and helpful, and the public areas magnificent. Oh, and the breakfast buffet was the best we've had in Europe; eggs, ham, 5 kinds of sausage, 5 or 6 kinds of bread, with a toaster that actually worked! Plus FRESH squeezed orange juice! Heavenly! A word of caution, the regular rooms cannot be this nice, as they are $70 less money, so if you can spring for the extra $$ it's sooo worth it. We felt like the Duke & Duchess of Windsor!
reviews.title: Best Hotel in Barcelona? Yep!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is in the middle of it all. It is not just close to La Rambla, when the lobby door opens, you are in La Rambla. There is a metro stop one block to your left, and the big metro and train stop underneathe Plaza Catalunyia one block to your right. The rooms are very large for the european standards and large enough for the american standards, they are also clean, silent and the windows seals all the light out. The staff is very professional, proper, correct and helpful. They have a nice breakfast for a few bucks. The staff told us to call if any noise disturbed us, because they are remodeling the second floor, but we never heard a hammer. For euro 200 per day, this hotel is a bargain. We paid more for another room that does not compare to this. This hotel is underrated, they are missing one or two stars. You want to know if we will stay there again? Yes, definitely.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This hotel was great. It was our last spot on our vacation and we could not have asked for more. The rooms were spacious and clean. The bathrooms were huge with a big spa bathtub. You have to turn your room keys in everytime you leave, but then you don't have to worry about losing them. Las Rambles was very busy and crowded, but you couldn't hear anything in the hotel. One of the friends I was traveling with got really sick the last day and the staff did everything they could to make it easier for her. We actually had to check out that day and they made her comfortable in the lobby with blankets and food. The staff went above and beyond. great hotel.
